title: [CRASH] Bug with patch 5.5
body:
The bug might have something to do with my computer running the windows 10 technical preview, but just in case it isn't that's why I'm making this post.
In the last patch I didn't have any issues playing then in this one I tried to play a game as Support Thresh, opened the item store bought my first item, then crashed and anytime I try to re-launch I just have 3-4 seconds before I crash again.
I included two screenshots of the bug.
The Game Info:
Co-op vs Intermediate bots
Ally champions were: Lulu, Riven, Ezreal, Karma, Thresh
Enemy champions were: Grungy Nunu, Cassiopeia, Lux, Ashe, Leona

Link to the match: http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/1757980462/32909128?tab=overview

replies.body: Same issue on both computers running Windows 10 Technical Preview (Different versions). I tried running it in compatibility mode, but this doesn't resolve the problem. I tried the launcher as well. Played a game yesterday just fine. build: 5.5.15_03_09_13_59
I have the same issue - W10 technical preview and crash after loading in.
Crash 10/10 on windows 10 for me too. Unplayable. Have not yet found a way to fix the crash. Riot fix pls

**EDIT: Yayyyyy, thank you very much Riot for fixing it.**




I have the same problem. (Win 10)
Before 5.5 everything, worked fine, therefore it has something to do with the patch.
I also heard, that a lot of people already told Riot while testing, therefore I don't understand, why they release the new patch, before fixing the problem.

Additionally the outgoing traffic (upstream) increased a lot causing problems with other programs like Teamspeak, after I tried to reconnect a few times into the game. It slowly decreased after closing LoL.

The most annyoing thing: After the end of the game LoL told me, that I left the game and have to type "I agree" to their ridiculous text, as if it was my fault. That was the first time that ever happened and I never left any games.
I didn't try to play any other games since that bug, but if I'll see that 5 minute timer, I'll get very angry. >:(
i see that 5 minute timer since the new patch was launched...right now i see a 10 minute timer...like if it was my fault for leaving games...

Since I didn't play another game, after the first one (except one test free play against bots and a friend to test something) and therefore "left" only 1 game, I hope that message just was a "warning" or something, and I won't see that ugly 5 minute timer.

IF I see that 5 minute timer I will be very angry at Riot.
A friend of mine got that timer once and we had him in our 5 people team, we had to wait fucking 5 minutes, not even being able to change masteries/runes or build an item set.
Then we got matched, some idot on the enemy team left and we had to wait ANOTHER 5 minutes.

All in all we WAITED 15 MINUTES to get into the game. And he is no leaver just had a bad internet once that dropped him out of games. (At least that's what I perceived when playing with him. He played most of his games with his character with me)

You better not,.. Riot.

I understand completely but this was first reported hours ago, there should be some red post warning in game about using windows 10, instead of hurting 4 other peoples ranked game play. Not to mention this will most likely drop me a bracket.


It seems pretty easy to me for you to put the same type of message in game that you do with disabled champions or other issues. I understand that this happens, but after 11 hours, some form of warning should not be out of the question. I'd like my loss to loss prevented along with anyone else who is having the same problem. 

I'll happily change operating systems again, I just again would like some sort of a warning in the little red circle you post all the time after patches.

I'm also in the Same Boat. Windows 10 tech preview. No Problems before hand. I had a Yorick and Fiora Aram with leaves. I'm sad that I'm penalized for League of Legends updating. Why is this not tested on windows 10?

For those of you guys saying that we should expect no compatibility for apps using Windows 10 is absolutely ridiculous. The preview is not just for people to test it out but also for companies to make sure their applications are stable for when it does launch. There is obviously a good amount of people using W10 now, so it should be a concern to a company when you have this many people not being able to use your product, no matter what we're using.

yesterday works prfectly and all games works perfectly it has been a error related with 5.5 patch

so shut up please, lot of people likeme have this SO and want a solution
I'm confused.  You agree with DJFX then tell them to shut up?

Hey all,

Unfortunately, Windows 10 Tech Preview is not directly supported just yet :(  For more information, **RiotAether **provided some context here:

> Hey everyone, thanks for the Windows 10 crash reports. As a lot of you have pointed out, we don't support Windows 10 yet so your mileage may vary as we work toward full compatibility. That said, MMACheerpuppy hit the nail on the head - we still want to do what we can to help those of you who've opted into the preview.
> 
> Speaking concretely, we're currently looking into a few leads from the log information that's been provided (animation and/or sound files appear to be the culprit at this point). No promises on timeline but we're hoping to get something out before the next patch.

Source: http://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/2yshlb/windows_10_preview_users_patch_55/cpcueg3
I am also having crash issues with my mac osx 10.7.5.  Everything was fine before this update. When I reach 100% in loading screen, I crash in every game mode.

hey just wanted to know if riot could maybe post something in the patch notes or something about this issue... clearly alot of people are having the same issue.. i just lost a series today because of my win 10 and i dont want others to suffer similar consequences...

While there are quite a number of comments here, a very small percentage of players use Windows 10 Tech Preview on a whole.  Although your suggestion is pretty solid.  I'll look into where we can proactively message about this!
Can we get a fucking patch today please?

Same with me, also Win 10! 
Crashes after 5sec in-game time!

For those of you who are saying that it's silly that we expect the devlopment team to make league compatible with Windows 10, I say this. Why does EVERY OTHER game I own work flawlessly? If other games being actively devolped can manage Windows 10 users, why does league get a pass? Windows 10 is going to be the new standard very soon, using the logic behind "it's an unstable, unsupported OS" is equally as absurd as your're making us out to be.
Welp its time to play Dota then..

I digged a little bit deeper into this crash and found the following. Every time the game crashes, one can find an error in the Windows Event Viewer application which shows that the crash results from a problem in ntdll.dll with exception code: 0xc000041d. Searching the web with this infos didn't revealed too much insight. However the error suggests that the LOL Client is hooking into a window but not releasing the handle (or that it didn't get the permission to the hook in the first place). 

Furthermore, one can reproduce the same error message without even to start a game. Start LOL, click on "Launch" in the patcher to arrive at the login screen. Now open any other program with admin rights (right click on a icon in the taskbar -> open as admin). There pops up a dialog asking if you really want to run this program, click cancel. Now the LOL client crashes. 
This shows that the problem has its roots not in some missing textures ect but is really connected how the lol client handles/hooks into windows. Thus I think this problem is also related to the crashes which happened even 5.4 if you switch between the fullscreen lol client and some other program.  This suspicion is further enhanced by the fact that these previous crashes resulted in exactly the same error message.
I hope this insights help riot to solve this problem more quickly!

SO I would have to downgrade to windows 7 to run League? I mean, I spent money to get Bard the first day, and I can't play him with this bug unless I want to lose all my information on my Hard Drive (which I won't do) to play League. To top it off I was going to host a LAN party tonight for League but no longer can. I dont expect a refund, but since over 15% of windows users (Roughly 24 million people) have windows 10, and of that I would guess 9% play League (about 2.1 million people). I would put this bug at the top of the to-do list. Cuz now I have to wait who knows how long to play League. 

As Riot Aether said " No promises on timeline but we're hoping to get something out before the next patch." Before the next patch? What, 3 weeks to a month away? And you hope to get it out by then? Riot may lose some customers because of this. Why not just Roll back to 5.4 where everything was working for everyone?
I guess the sadder part is, there are also Win7, Win8, and Win XP users here that have voiced out their concerns and issues regarding the latest patch :D We crash too {{champion:32}}
Why doesn't the game automatically recognize crashing due to a game patch problem and give forgiveness to the team and to the player for 'AFK'?
I just got placed in low priority queue because of this... Q~Q

Another confirmation of Windows 10 TP crashing after a few seconds of game. I was in ARAM so not a SR bug it would seem.

In  Event viewer see it also.

Running windows 8.1 and I can't even launch the client without the game freezing my entire system making me manually turn it off and back on. Does it every single time I try to launch league, have never had this problem with anything before. Windows updated last night and ever since these problems have been occurring. I've attempted to launch the game approximately 10 times and it froze my system every single time. What is causing this?
Yeah repeated crashing of the client and after you reinstall you get greeted with some threat of action like it was your fault. Thanks riot maybe fix your client?
Mine is doing the same thing keeps crashing over and over.  Guess they didn't test this patch at all.  Crashing on both a Windows 10 client and Windows 7 client.  Great patch yet again.

I have the same problem. Patch 5.4 was perfect for Windows 10.
Today LoL updated and i can't play a game with the patch 5.5.

As somebody who works in a technical support/development position, the fact that you people are expecting compatibility from a public beta of an operating system with a live application is ludicrous. 

This is not a full operating system. It is a *technical preview*, it is not a complete build of what is going to be released as the actual product. 

Why would Riot be concentrating on making sure their application runs on a technical preview? Applications and Operating Systems change when going from Beta to Beta to official release. 

Its not like pulling a lever the game is automatically compatible with the operating system. It takes time to write the code in development, work through Q&A and then finally get pushed out to the actual product. 

You take a risk when you decide to install a beta of an operating system. There are no guarantees it will work with any existing application that doesn't belong to Microsoft and even when the official build of Windows 10 releases, it does not mean LoL will even be supported with it then. 

Companies never jump on an operating system when it first releases, doesn't anybody remember Windows Vista? We have products within my company that are just getting supported with Windows 8 and we provide hospitality management software for properties around the world. 

Obviously not everybody with a technical background knows or even understands this, but what you're asking for is just absurd. If LoL doesn't work with this new patch, revert to your previous operating system. Riot has no obligation to ensure their product works with a technical preview of an operating system.

God I hope I never work in the same team as you.

Certainly there's no legal obligation to support a technical preview, but for Riot has good cause to look into issues with LoL and Windows 10 now:

- As mentioned, Windows 10 is going public quite soon. Saying that companies don't jump onto operating systems immediately is a moot point as who plays League at work? There will certainly be a sizable uptake of **individuals**, particularly of the power user variety, as soon as MS goes into production phase.

- Goodwill. Sure there's no legal obligation but there are thousands of Win10 users already, if they just let the problem slide until release how much flak will Riot get on release? 

- Financial loss. "I Can't play the game? Why should I buy those shiny new skins coming out?" Not a huge factor since Win10 users aren't exactly a massive percentage of LoL's user base but it would affect the bottom line, however marginally.

Sure, it's not a priority, Windows 10 IS a theoretically unstable OS and there's no LEGAL obligation to look at it. That doesn't mean there's no reason for Riot to do so, even if it's just to stop people from flooding the forums with bug reports.

In any case, Riot isn't solely in this for the money - as far as I've seen over the years they genuinely want people to enjoy the game, so I think it is going to be looked at simply so that we can do so.
So that's it, huh? "Deal with it"
How the hell does this have 80 up-votes in 12 hours, but my post about this happening on mac has been up for a few days now (since patch 5.4). AND this wasn't even fixed in 5.5...
Because there is more Windows 10 users playing League than Mac users playing League. And you should really really dual boot your Mac if you want to play.
I have windows 8 and I'm encountering this problem. it's not just windows 10 preview.

I still have **Win7** and my League won't start a game. It would just crash, I would try to reconnect and nothing happens. Nothing happens but a BUGSPLAT. I don't think this is an isolated case for Win10 users. I've read the comments and even people with **Win8** and **WinXP** have the same problem.

I tried repairing, it's still the same.
All the people bitching about it only affecting windows 10 need to stop and listen, I'm on windows 8 and I cant even log in as it crashes my computer as soon as enter my password {{item:3151}}

Guys, Riot can't help you with an unstable OS environment. When trying to download Windows 10 tech preview, microsoft warned you about it. Best solution would be to revert the W10 update and see what happens. 
Taken right from Windows 10 download site. [HERE](http://windows.microsoft.com/en-gb/windows/preview-iso)
"Important

Remember, trying out an early build like this can be risky. That's why we recommend that you don't install the preview on your primary home or business PC. Unexpected PC crashes could damage or even delete your files, so you should back up everything."

Funny thing is that it was running smoothly yesterday. This means that Riot messed things up for W10 users with there 5.5 build, not microsoft. In a few months W10 will be public released and Riot isn't checking there build for any future realeases of Windows. This can be a major problem in the near future for Riot if they doen't fix it by then, thousend, maybe millions of users will upgrade and there Leage of Legends will have to wait for it to be repaired.
That's true, if League is not running smooth till the public release, Riot get's in big trouble. Atm I can understand, that it's not working, but Riot should fix it quickly.
same thing is happening to me, windows 10 tech preview. win10 just recived an update last night. can't tell if its league or windows.
I tried PBE a couple of days ago and the exact same thing happen. It's definitely League that fucked something up as every version up until 5.4 worked perfectly.

I somehow fixed my Windows 10 install by screwing with my .dll files.

One or both of these things fixed it:

Deleting d3d9.dll and d3dx9_39.dll from c:\windows\system32

Or changing the permissions on d3d9.dll and d3dx9_39.dll in c:\windows\SysWow64 to not be owned by trusted installer. (I changed my ownership to Administrators).

Sorry, I broke this quite a bit before it started working but those are the two major changes I made. One or both of them might have fixed it.
proof:

World first Windows 10 Bard out of fountain -

http://i.imgur.com/hWJ2wTN.jpg

EDIT// - This might actually be because I rolled back Windows 10 versions.  Tried a bunch of things at once like an idiot.  You can reboot and tell it to rollback to the previous if that's the case.
Pretty sad Rito.
I need my league. D,,: it's been so long. :(

Why are you guys even trying to play a PvP match when this issue is obviously present?
I'm sure they are working on a fix, be patient. Our operating system will not be 100% supported until release but that also means that if they patch it now they wont have to worry about the same issue when the official release comes out.

**If you want to test the crash for a patch, load up a custom game and see if you can stay in game more than 5 seconds. It will let you know if it's patched yet or not!!**
Riot: "It's been 6 days, they still think we care about W10 users."
Needed to download 5MB with the Client today, checked ingame if anything works now with W10, but still crashes -> no BugFix today

since I got leave buster for 5 mins, ill spend it writing to riot about how its bull shit they didn't warn anyone patch 5.5 would crash. we test w10, a little heads up that shit will go wrong would of been nice? or wait... that's asking way to much from your customers right? what a joke.
Any update on the status of a hotfix release timeline?
